body_html:
Just to confirm I'm very interested in this, for inference with lots of data and lots of linear algebra. As @betanalpha says, there's really no competitor to HMC in these cases.

For the use cases I have in mind, I'd want to write out the density in standard TensorFlow then use a TensorFlow method to sample from it with HMC, in much the same way as the current optimisers. I wouldn't be looking for an Edward- or STAN-like language for model specification for this use case (though I think both are awesome).

A suite of samplers would seem like the obvious generalisation to me. HMC with NUTS or other adaptive/non-adaptive procedures; Metropolis-Adjusted Langevin algorithm?; there may even be cases where people want straightforward MH. Gibbs sampling (which requires understanding of conjugacy) doesn't fit in this pattern though.
